website_summaries.verdict: Known for its exceptional sound and compatibility with modern PC software.
pros: Ideal for business travelers who utilize Skype and VoIP services and require clear connectivity throughout the world
Use the microphone on either right or left side
Customers love the sound quality so much they use the headset for music and movies
cons: Will muffle ambient noise, but not voices or music

customer_reviews.title: its a Senneheiser !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Working in a call center AND from home, tried more than 9 different headsets, looking for comfort/sound CLARITY, and QUALITY , purchased out of pocket headsets to use at the call center, because I needed the best, and this was it, this brand is EXCELLENT, I understand now, why most telecommunication companies/call centers are using it, sound quality, and clarity VERY good, I didn't try it for music, I needed it for telephony, and it is perfect for that, light weight, and lets your ears breath, IMPORTANT, especially for someone working 10 hour shifts like me. I would like to try the other models they have, but will wait for now.
customer_reviews.author: ZiadTurk

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and build but isn't on the list to work well with Dragon Naturally Speaking.
customer_reviews.text: These sound great and are fairly well made. Definitely not super sturdy but you can see that just by looking. They held up well. The reason I got them was to use with Dragon Naturally Speaking. Unfortunately they were not on the list of recommended headset mics to be used with Dragon. I had assumed that because Sennheiser is a well known brand name that it would be a good fit It was disappointing that it wasn't. That is much more likely to be the fault of Dragon than it is Sennheiser. It is Dragon after all that needs to be certain that their software works with other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Could be sturdier, and needs a Muted indicator. But still ok.
customer_reviews.text: The wire that connects this to the laptop is thin and prone to tangling. Ultimately, that wire will be the failure point, unless you sit on the headphones first. It's just not very sturdy. But it sounds ok, and conversations are clear. It's light and comfortable. Treat it very gently and it should give years of service. The USB jack glows when the device is plugged in; a small piece of electricians tape will take care of that. The mute switch on the cord DOESN'T have an indicator light, so if you mean to mute, make sure you actually slid the switch and didn't just think you did. That cost it a star.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Online Teaching
customer_reviews.text: I teach English online to kids in China and this headset is my third in 1.5 years. It's by far the best that I've used. It is light, doesn't feel claustrophobic on my head and has been durable so far. The one thing I will say is that the headband resting on my head for 4 hours at a time can get a bit uncomfortable. I fixed that by putting a small piece of adhesive backed foam at the top. Problem solved. I would gladly buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole E.

customer_reviews.title: Expected more considering the price and the Sennheiser name.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars except for the cheap foam ear pads and the comfort. Headset has minimal noise cancellation, cheap foam ear pads, and become uncomfortable after a few hours. For this price Sennheiser should have included better ear pads. I will be returning the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Carla R.

customer_reviews.title: This looks to be the best choice, especially for the reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is what they call plug and play! No setup required, it just works. The sound quality is stunning (as Sennheiser is known for). As indecisive as I can be, I relooked at the different models for at least two weeks, but this one kept coming back as a true quality one. This looks to be the best choice, especially for the reasonable price. I can strongly recommend it for making phone calls and listening music / watching movies! Using it with my Microsoft Surface Pro.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is better than I expected. The headset is light and you could wear it all day without issues. I use this frequently with Zoom and Google Hangouts, everyone says I come through sounding fine. This is much better (and cheaper) than the plantronics headset I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Malin

customer_reviews.title: Great headset sound, excellent mic (except that noice canceling could be better)
customer_reviews.text: Great headset and mic. You can't go wrong with Sennheiser for quality. It has a very good mic, but the noise canceling could be better. However...if you want a very high quality sound in the headset for a very good price...buy this one!!!!! The headset quality is almost as good as a professional set of Sennheiser that I use when playing my Fender Strat in my condo! You hear great 'deep' base tones and also 'excellent' high tones. As long as noise canceling is not that important to you, I don't think you will find anything better for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Microsoft LX-3000 in noisy environment
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for noise cancellation as well as audio + mic in a noisy environment. I was replacing a LX-3000 that I'd had for about 10 years. The sound was great in quiet moments, but because it is not an over-the-ear design, it is not ideal for noisy environments. I would still recommend the Microsoft model if you have a lot of background noise.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Quality OK
customer_reviews.text: I use these for creating screencasts for online courses, and so I sometimes wear these for a few hours at time. They're comfortable for a while, but after a few hours my ears start to hurt. I previously had a cheap, generic headset that were the same comfort. The recording quality is decent but not as good as I would have expected. I had to add my own foam cover over the microphone to prevent pops and wind noise. Technology-wise, these are great--they worked with my Windows 7 system without a problem. In reality, what I probably need is something a bit more expensive, so this is probably the right combination of cost and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Just Your Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately it became a tasty dog treat...
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well until my dog decided to try them out. She loved them. Especially the cord. There wasn't much left to be recognized after she was through. i would not recommend leaving anywhere within a hint of range with puppies afoot. The set was good though. After my dog ages a bit, i will get another set.
customer_reviews.author: Gailand

customer_reviews.title: If the foam ear piece covers didn't fall off, I'd like this a lot more.
customer_reviews.text: This headset works fine for basic function; the sound quality is good, the microphone works well enough, the mute switch works, and the volume control is easy to use. I bought this headset so I could use the microphone with a language program, but the program's voice recognition was so bad that it is worthless. I still use the headset because the volume control is convenient. The only other issue is that the foam ear piece covers will not stay on. They just fall off and I don't notice it until I put the headset on and realize that it is very uncomfortable. I suppose I should just toss the headset and buy a better set of head phones...
customer_reviews.author: homeboy

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and comfortable. Mic seems to work well. Mic rolls up out of the way easily. I didn't necessarily pay close enough attention, but this headset uses a USB connection so you can't use it with anything but a computer. This is ok for me, but means it can't pull double duty. Don't expect stellar audio quality for listening to music. They do work very well for the 1.5 hr conference calls I have every few weeks. They seem to be tuned specifically for this and make other voices very clear. Overall, I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Distracted Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Work in customer support, used for VOIP calls
customer_reviews.text: I work from home one day per week, in customer support, use these for VOIP calls. My customers are picky about sound quality; if they can't understand me, I am doing them no good. No one has ever complained about sound quality when I used these. The headset is comfortable, which is important to me, as I might be on a call for hours at a time. The only problem I have had is the incoming sound control wheel is on the cord, and it's pretty touchy. If I bump my cord against anything, the sound level changes. Once I figured out what caused it, I have had no trouble avoiding it.
customer_reviews.author: John in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: An awesome headset
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the sturdiest, best sounding headset I have ever owned. Super long cord, great volume control (no noisey pot here), and a well designed mic that gets up out of your way. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: They do  what they're designed for beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: This works great but, it didn't at first. The mute switch is labeled backwards. Mute on is microphone on. Mute off is microphone on. If they had called it an on off switch for the mic they would have been correct but it is confusing. That said, they're clear, they're light weight and they're comfortable. People I've talked to with them have noticed they're way, way better than the Plantronics unit they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headset
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent purchase for the price. I get compliments from people about my microphone quality when I'm voice chatting with others. The only downside I notice is that there is very little bass to the headphones. There's just enough there to fill in the noise, but not enough to make it a rich experience.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: One of the best headsets there is
customer_reviews.text: One of the best headsets there is. Audio quality is just perfect for voice calls. After discovering them 6-7 years ago I just keep buying them for the employees at work and went through a few of them myself (lost while travelling, gave away, etc.). If you intend to abuse them as much as I do - buy some replacement foam earpads here on Amazon. Comes handy when you accidentally tear an earpad while unpacking your carry-on, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable. Poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Can remember when Sennheiser was a name synonymous with huh-end audio. These headphones betray that legacy. Despite over a half hour trying all manner of adjustments of the headband and microphone – I was never able to achieve proper fit or good quality listening and voice transmission. And they weren't cheap. Obviously with the growth of VOIP and FaceTime – there is a compelling need for comfortable headsets with superior voice quality. This Sennheiser headset is a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: msidoric

customer_reviews.title: great sound quality, great value.
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love these. great sound quality both from the mic and the headphones themselves. sound is clear and distinct. love the toggle for mute and picking/hanging up the phone. this is a godsend for people who make or receive calls on their computer. took me a minute to figure out how to still listen to my computer speakers while using the headphones for calls, but it was well worth the time spent finding out. great product even at twice this price.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: OK. A little uncomfortable and cord a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: These are o.k. I bought them to be portable Skype headphones I can use with my laptop. They are clear and the mic works well. I find after an hour or so my ears start to hurt, too much pressure. I wish the cord was shorter and easier to wrap & unwrap (maybe having a single wire instead of the traditional Y split). I can't help but be a bit disappointed. Reasonably cheap and appear to be high quality though. I have an old pair on on-ear Plantronics that are way more comfortable but less compact.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Microphone - Perfect for what I want.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 2016/04/08 Well... the mute switch started going bad. My listeners were able hear pops when I flipped the Mute switch. I purchased a Microsoft Life Chat 6000 as a replacement but I'm not sure I'm happy with the way it fit's - it's too tight. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I purchased this headset for work to do VOIP phone calls using Lync. I've been on about 10 Lync phone calls so far and everyone on the other end says that I sound great. From a music perspective, the sound is fine. I bought the headset for the microphone not the headphones. I like the switch mute.
customer_reviews.author: Salutations!

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely FANTASTIC Headset!
customer_reviews.text: I got advice from an electronics expert in my family on what headset to purchase for Dragon Dictation. He said you need a good microphone for speech recognition or it will not work very well and he said Sennheiser makes some of the best headsets. I purchased this one based upon his advice and I could not be more pleased. Dragon was able to understand me quite well and the microphone is excellant. Thanks so much for making a quality product for a great price. The higher priced ones are no doubt even better but this one does more than suffice and I am quite pleased with the quality and price!
customer_reviews.author: Rae W

customer_reviews.title: Windows 8.1 USB Audio Device Driver install failure prevents headset installing successfully and/or finding any needed drivers
customer_reviews.text: It's not that I don't like it, but I cannot use it. It seems to be more of a Windows 8.1 issue and so far none of the headsets I have purchased will work.. I spent two hours on phone with Toshiba recently (my laptop brand) and they attempted too install a driver however after two installs, it did not work. I went to Microsoft website and found numerous old and current articles on Windows 8.1 USB Audio Device Driver install failures. So looks like I will need to return my headset (s) and buy a new laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Head

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit Well, Had to Return
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed with these at all, compared to another pair of Sennheiser monitoring phones I used to own. They didn't fit well (the bar that connects the phone is very rigid, doesn't mold to the contours of your head well), and as a consequence didn't sit on my ears correctly. Also the mic quality was poor in terms of output. When played back my voice sounded terrible compared to better mics like the Audio-Technica USB stand-alone models. Tried to do the headphone / mic combo but it's tough to meet the quality compared to a decent pair of monitoring phones and a stand-alone USB mic.
customer_reviews.author: Some Random ReviewerTop Contributor: Science Fiction Books

customer_reviews.title: Noisy microphone
customer_reviews.text: This product features noise cancellation but I pick up some extra static noise compared to cheaper products. I do not know whether the static noise is a side effect of the super-strong environmental noise cancellation. I do not have constant environmental noise to compare it with other products. BTW, it is tight for people with a big head.
customer_reviews.author: Qichen Gu

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from analog.
customer_reviews.text: I use these daily for making phone calls with Google Voice, as well as Webex and other video conferencing. My previous headset was analog, which worked okay, however having a USB set is nice since they act as a separate sound device. So I can route music to my regular speakers and calls to my headset. Oh, and the sound quality of both the speakers and mic are excellent for teleconferencing use.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Diepenbrock

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have used this headset for months now and I'm very happy. I use it with my iMac for screencasts and video voice-overs. I find the audio quality to be excellent. It comes with a long USB cord that gives me freedom to walk around and not be tethered directly to my desk while using. It is very lightweight and comfortable to wear. Sennheiser makes good stuff. Buy this product with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the understanding that it was mid range in industry quality and I wasn't disappointed. It works for me and does what I need it to do. I'm sure that there are high end headsets out there but this seems like a quality set to me after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Good Mic
customer_reviews.text: I tried several models but this one has a microphone quality good enough to use for narration recording. It is what I would expect from Sennheiser after using their products professionally for decades.
customer_reviews.author: ideabuzz

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great performance for the price. I have a headset that cost 2x with worse sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Looney

customer_reviews.title: Volume not loud enough for call center VCC, after 3rd call had to switch back to old headset.
customer_reviews.text: Work In call center, has volume control but it is not loud enough to hear over background noise. Unfortunately I can’t use them and will have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: M. McCraw

customer_reviews.title: Wow definite 5 stars for these
customer_reviews.text: These sound great, the microphone is clear sounding. Grabbed a so called used pair, appeared new and untouched, and definitely an even better deal this way. Long cable Easy to use inline controls Illuminated 'Sennheiser logo' USB plug, which has the built in ADC/DAC and Looks good! Edit: After trying the Sennheiser SC60 series the PC36 gets down voted now...The SC60's are far superior and sound better too.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality sound and quite comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am an elder of a church and I bought this to preach during my church's Sunday virtual (online) worship. The audio quality is good and the headset is light and comfortable. Microphone has nice and clear voice reproduction even after Zoom's heavy compression. Worth the price. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, buy a Logitech
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute garbage, the mic in my laptop records better sound than this mic. The audio in the headset reminds me of a pair of old school Walkman headphones, and is worse than the mic. The unit is horribly uncomfortable to wear for any extended amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: John Keyzer

customer_reviews.title: Let your voice be heard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set after people were complaining that my old headset was clicking alot. It was my ceiling fan making noise while I was on my MagjicJack. This unit, filters out the noise problem, now, if it could only filter out my barking dogs!!! The driver pluged in seamlessly into Majic Jack and Skype. My old plantronics would disapprear in MagicJack and I reinstall it and do hand stands to get it to work sevearl times a week. I've had this for almost a year without any problems. The people on the other end say the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: cabin808

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Headset
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the headset about three times, but it is definitely more comfortable and the sound is much better than the plantronics I previously had. The only reason I don't give five (5) stars is that I wish these were more portable - foldable and had a case. I use them with my laptop/softphone and they are cumbersome to travel with. Definitely don't fit in a laptop case.
customer_reviews.author: beachgal

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good headset, the sound quality is great
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good headset, the sound quality is great. Perhaps not the most comfortable headset if using the headset all day. The headset foam cushions could have been of a better design. I ended up replacing the headset cushions with the cushions from my previously used broken) headset.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Microphone quality is good with Dragon Dictation
customer_reviews.text: Microphone quality is good with Dragon Dictation. Was not as easy to set up (with Dragon Dictation) as my old cheap logitech headset but the mic and speakers on the Sennheiser are superior. I'm only dinging it 1 star as there is no headband cushion and it hurts my scalp. I removed the cushion from a prior broken set of headphones and used this to alleviate some of the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Sound great but wear on the ears after a while.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great but with the thin foam covering on the ears, they can get a bit painful for me after about an hour. For the price. performance and as infrequently as I use them, they are great. Some ear pad upgrade replacements would be awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming4x4

customer_reviews.title: comfortable for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I use these for voice chat on the PC for mumble and ventrilo and wear them around my neck. They are fairly comfortable in that position, not too big and the mic is good quality. I wish they didn't have an in-line mute because I accidentally mute myself on occasion. For the price, the quality is excellent and if I can't find a mic that will fit around my neck without a headset attached, I will buy these again when I eventually destroy them.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela C.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value For the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset knowing that Sennheiser would not give me a substandard product... I was not disappointed. I mostly use it for listening to music on my computer. The inline volume control is handy. I also occaisionally use the microphone for Google searches on my Chrome browser. It works just fine. The sound quality is excellent. It could be a little louder - although I suspect most people wouldn't share my opinion on this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: My brother recommended them to me and I was definitely not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I was looking for. My brother recommended them to me and I was definitely not disappointed. They are great for gaming, watching videos, listening to music and taking Skype calls. The sound quality is great and it fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Schupbach

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser PC 36 Call Control USB Binaural Headset
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones, to use with dragon naturally speaking talk to text They work great comfortable to wear for long periods of time, and a good stereo Sound when listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Elbert Collins

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but cannot figure out how to switch L-R for earphones
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable, sturdy headset. However, I'm left-handed, and I wish there was a way (without some clunky Windows software re-configuration) to switch the Left and Right headphone sounds, since I prefer to have my microphone arm on the right side of my face. By default, you only have the option of wearing the microphone on your left side, since it is attached to the default left-side earphone.
customer_reviews.author: mnlop

customer_reviews.title: Success
customer_reviews.text: Finally! good sound and a practical price. Works great linked into a radio sound system. I'm pleased. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: An excellent headset that is very comfortable to wear, even with glasses, for hours at a time. Music quality is quite good as well, no buzzing, rich sound, etc. This is hands-down the best headset in this price range. If you already have a soundcard, go with the identically-constructed (but cheaper) non-USB equivalent, the PC 31-II.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: This headset was recommended to me by the Univ
customer_reviews.text: This headset was recommended to me by the Univ. of Delaware for voice archiving. Clean recording for an inexpensive headset - much better than my old analog headset. Lightweight and comfort is pretty good. I do miss the plush ear cushions on my old inexpensive Altec Lansings. A good value at $36.
customer_reviews.author: Laird B Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price. Pads could be thicker/softer. My ears started getting sore after about 6 hours of continuous use. I gave it five stars for performance/price. Excellent audio quality (for the size) and crystal clear microphone.
customer_reviews.author: DanielT

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headset
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is okay for most usage. I use it for Dragon, and the occasional late night music session. The only negative, I keep forgetting to turn on the microphone. Actually that's a good feature as Dragon will pick up almost any noise. The volume control could be better. Often one has to adjust system volume to get it right. Otherwise hearing loss could result.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Harper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Headset!
customer_reviews.text: Love this headset! Excellent sound quality! Perfect for all those Zoom meetings, webinars, and presentations.
customer_reviews.author: TheDiva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, noise canceling, the USB part is a quite over-sized. I recently Windows may suddenly refuse to discover the device -- i use it with several laptops / audiences I work remotely with so frequent pluggin / unplugging is a necessity. Make sure to have more than one USB port on the computer you plan to us it and not be embarrassed when fails to function. I am about to shop for a more expensive item by Sennheiser
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.. dosen't reflect Sennheiser quality
customer_reviews.text: These headsets are just ok. I have better headsets from Senheisser but for the price, its quality is ok. Fits well over your head. The clip for the mike is a waste, its not like the regular pinch clip with most other headphones. Its hard to have it stay in one place or clip to your shirt. If looking for something cheap, this would work
customer_reviews.author: sultansfam

customer_reviews.title: Very light and comfortable, with high quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second PC-36 headset. The first one failed after many years of intense use, packed and unpacked daily in my backpack. The weak point probably is the USB plug, which is rather large since it houses the signal processing electronics. The other drawback is the difficulty in finding spare foam pads for the earpieces. However, the main point is that it far surpasses any other light headset I know both in noise-cancelling microphone and reproduction sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Horacious

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and sound great
customer_reviews.text: I use them all day, every day for conference calls. They don’t crunch my ears, and the sound quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beth

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser fan
customer_reviews.text: I love Sennheiser headphones but this one is not for me. The sound quality is very decent and the microphone works very well. The problem is that I use them for hours everyday and they are uncomfortable on my ears. I wear glasses so maybe it has something to do with that but these will be replaced soon. Works perfectly aside from the personal comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jaloobee

customer_reviews.title: but my biggest gripe is that the sound quality is poor. The person on the other end can hear ...
customer_reviews.text: This headset gets the job done and has decent features, but my biggest gripe is that the sound quality is poor. The person on the other end can hear me just fine (good microphone), but the sound through the earpiece is too soft. Even with the volume turned up to the max, it's still a bit low and difficult to hear the other person.
customer_reviews.author: M. Borromeo

customer_reviews.title: Mic stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked it, but the headset was never fully compatible with MS Teams, and ultimately it gave out after 6 months: I could hear, but no one could hear me. We tried it on different computers, still no luck
customer_reviews.author: CHI-town Scotsman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, and very comfortable. I first tried a less expensive one, and my dictation software wasn't picking up on everything I said, and the headset wasn't comfortable. This one is adjustable and very comfortable, and the same dictation software is picking up on almost everything I say. Worth a few extra dollars to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Workes well for an older model
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the Headset for the many web meetings now in my day. Needed to order separably as it's an older model, a headset / microphone splitter for used with my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for VOIP applications
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this headset for about a year now with Skype and GoToMeeting and it is great!. Cord is long enough that I can walk around, sound quality is terrific, the mic is convenient and the head set is light weight and comfortable. I have no echo problems, no volume problems and the participants tell me my sound quality is very good. I bought one for home and one to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this for a WoW friend who did not have a headset. I use a more expensive Sennheiser model. But my buddy says this is a fantastic headset and is very, very pleased with it. The only negative I could mention is that my headset tends to hurt my ears after a few hours of wear but the sound quality is perfect and the ease of use is definitely "there".
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Norman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Noise-Cancelling Headset
customer_reviews.text: They are fabulous! You cannot beat this quality for the money. The noise cancelling feature of the microphone is quite effective. I ordered these for $45.99. Received yesterday. Now the price is $41.99. Kind of annoyed to be honest. But, the product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: T K Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am on Skype and GoToMeeting almost every day for business purposes, and the Sennheiser has a great mic and very clear sound. I preferred the USB connection, as I work on a Mac at home that has that has a six channel surround sound hookup (impossible to use without feedback and endless loops on a Skype or GoToMeeting video or call) so the USB was the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Texastransplant

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gift for the price
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my little bro a while back. It was his first headset and it worked great for months after his birthday (he got a more expensive headset for Christmas, but still uses this one occasionally).
customer_reviews.author: Domenica Campanella

customer_reviews.title: on/off mic switch is barely visible
customer_reviews.text: on/off mic switch labels are barely visible, so i never know am I on air or not during meetings
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super weight head phones!!
customer_reviews.text: You can wear this headphones for a long hours and won’t get stiff neck etc. Great sounds! Great quality!! Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: bluekitty

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is good for what I use it for (VoIP gaming clients
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good for what I use it for (VoIP gaming clients; Mumble). I like that the USB gives it its own sound device so I can have game sounds out my speakers and voices only in my head. It's comfortable for long periods of use, but the microphone seems pretty directional and you can appear very quiet to your peers unless it's aligned correctly. For what I use it for, which is only piss-quality audio anyway, it gets the job done splendidly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but there are better
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as the other Sennheiser headsets with the larger ear phones, but works okay. I probably wouldn't buy it again, though, I would get the one with larger earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ordinary citizen

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with EasyBooks.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use with Learning Ally's EasyBooks software. I don't know if the incompatibility is with Windows 10 or EasyBooks, or me, but I could not generate sufficient gain to record. Might be fine for other uses, but not the one I needed. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: RSc-Boca

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality or bad luck?
customer_reviews.text: I love these but these are the second pair that has broken.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Howell

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight, quality headphones for voice conversations
customer_reviews.text: Nice light weight headphones. I bought them to use with iphone in my home office, had to purchase apple specific RCA jack adapter but it works great. Folks I speak with say the microphone works very well picking up my voice.
customer_reviews.author: NCAmazonCust

customer_reviews.title: Better than Logitech!
customer_reviews.text: USB port connection works with a Mac. Sounds pretty good for music and Skype calls...much better than Logitech, which always breaks on me. Only complaint is that it's bulky for traveling and volume doesn't go high enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Worked Okay, Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: Used for six months, microphone quit in a couple months, right side of headphones quit recently. Headphones should last longer than that! A disgrace to the Sennheiser name. Volume control was nice while they worked and they had a rather compressed but standard sound. Good for watching movies, not quite up to standard for studio audio work.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Grest value
customer_reviews.text: Work very well. I like the built in sound card
customer_reviews.author: ekarges

customer_reviews.title: Headphone with microphone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headphone mainly for speaking with friends over the Internet. This is a convenient device that allows me to move about a few feet around while speaking. A desktop microphone does not allow me to do this unless I take the microphone with me, which is not practical. The sound quality is very good for the price. I often use it to listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Daiki

customer_reviews.title: Good quality headset for Skype
customer_reviews.text: A light but effective quality headset for Skype. I have also used this for Dragon Naturally Speaking and found its accuracy quite good which is a major plus.
customer_reviews.author: Frespkr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just got these headphones for my Windows7 laptop. Windows recognized and installed the drivers in seconds, no problems. The headset is very comfortable and the sound quality is great. Skype calls are absolutely clear and music sounds great too. Just the right bass response and clear midrange and highs. Other reviewers said that there's no volume control, but there certainly is on the my set, it works great and has a mute button. The microphone swings out of the way when you're not talking. If you want a great sounding, comfortable, lightweight, usb headset for less than $60, then this will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: SteveInArizona

customer_reviews.title: so it's pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Picked it out to use for dictating into my Dragon software, but the mike isn't very sensitive, and the mike boom can't be moved closer to your face, so it's pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.author: FranknJack

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The noise deadening needs improvement, but excellent clarity and sound, people I Skype with say they hear me quite clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like all the other reviews say, it's a great headset for the money
customer_reviews.text: There have already been many positive reviews of this headset. I use it at the office for the numerous webexes I'm on (gag). Sound is crisp and clear and mike works really well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: Mic Mute switch didn't work -  but it's relatively comfortable & reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Cables are rather light weight. I wonder how long they will last. Sound seems decent but I didn't compare it in a A/B test to anything else -- and didn't do much to evaluation mic quality. For the money these low end Sennheisers often seem to be a safe bet in that price range.
customer_reviews.author: Cortlandt Wilson

customer_reviews.title: small lite headset
customer_reviews.text: Hi yes We do like this headset it is light weight and both sides adjust well. Only wish ear was a little bigger and the volume adjust was a little tighter (not so loose or east to move) Had trouble playing games before we got the new headset, games play well now. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Excellant product for a corded, light weight USB Headset
customer_reviews.text: Good sound reproduction in the headset and audio recording via the microphone. Speedy delivery.... plus it came with a handfull of Tootsie Roll miniatures).
customer_reviews.author: Dave H.

customer_reviews.title: Good headset, old style two prong attachment
customer_reviews.text: Has old fashioned two prong attachment. I had to buy an adapter. Once I got the adapter the headset works great with PC and iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: W from Chicago Metro

customer_reviews.title: Don't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Worked great while they lasted. 5 months later the mic stopped working. If you jiggle the wire where it goes into the switch/volume control, you'll get some static, so it's obviously a bad connection in there.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great with dragon dictation on my mac book pro!
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PC Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent with a PC and Internet Phone systems. My contacts mentioned how great this microphone worked and the clarity given. I have used this on the new G-mail Internet phone-call system and it was great. Excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: P. Noga

customer_reviews.title: Major improvement for voice recognition and telephone calls
customer_reviews.text: Having used a variety of headsets for voice dictation to Dragon Dictate, the quality of this headset was a significant improvement. I actually use the in line mute and volume controls too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: PC 36 USB Headset
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hands free headset I've used for my long conference calls. The sound is crisp and clear while everyone else says they hear me just fine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred the computer guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent USB headset but did not last long enough
customer_reviews.text: Excellent USB headset but did not last long enough. The cables from the ear pieces come off/break at the connection. Did not expect this from a brand such as Sennheiser. Shouldn't this be a one time buy lasting 10 years?
customer_reviews.author: BaySoul

customer_reviews.title: Needs some cushioning
customer_reviews.text: The headset worked well...however, I am only giving 4 stars because it could use some cushion on the head...after 8 hours my head hurt terribly...it is definitely designed for a larger head perhaps. The sound was TERRIFIC as was the mic...having the extra long cord was nice, as I could move around.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Staack Christensen

customer_reviews.title: They wors great for video conferences and as a headset for computer-based ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't plan on using these headphones for music. They wors great for video conferences and as a headset for computer-based communications. But the music quality is terrible so don't expect it to be great at listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Calkins

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: High quality headphones that do not squeeze your brains out. Very worthwhile purchase. You can't go wrong with Sennheiser, I have other products by them.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganMag

customer_reviews.title: This microphone rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Used a much cheaper microphone and was greatly disappointed. This microphone has great audio quality for recording and playback - I use it for recording lectures. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Miller

customer_reviews.title: never could get it to work
customer_reviews.text: terrible... won't work and no one can tell me why.... i tried working with the manufacturer and they don't have a clue why
customer_reviews.author: Nan C

customer_reviews.title: Worthless junk. Move on.
customer_reviews.text: Mic failed after just 2 weeks of use. Very flimsy construction and cord. Worthless junk. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great sound
customer_reviews.text: what a great headset, it is the second one i bought so far and it has been always a great quality. the sound is great for that small of a headset, the bass is very deep and it gets pretty loud. some people might not like that it is rather light weight and not made for heavy duty and wont last you as long as a pricier sennheiser product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I have these on my head 4-5 hours a day and I have no problems wearing them this long. Sound quality is very good. I use them for Skype and video conferencing.
customer_reviews.author: Russell H

customer_reviews.title: Like the headset myself
customer_reviews.text: Like the headset myself. I hear everyone just fine. Some people I am talking to say my voice is too soft. That may be the software I am using though (Avaya IP agent).
customer_reviews.author: Todd

product_meta.title: Sennheiser PC 131 Binaural Headset with Volume Control and Microphone Mute
product_meta.description: Color:Silver With CharcoalComfortable over the head design for gamers or chat line users. Headset uses noise cancelling mic and adjustable boom
feature_bullets: Over the head binaural headphone, 2 x 3.5mm stereo jacks for both voice and microphone PC sockets
Stereo headset with single sided cable
In-line volume control and mic mute

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars633 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
